intro: Phlomoides azerbaijanica, commonly known as the Azerbaijani phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region, particularly Azerbaijan. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
